descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...2 red lines and 1 to 4 blue dots
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...stay the same
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...change the dot color from blue to yellow, and connect them to the red line using blue dots. Mirror the same design on the bottom but instead of stopping where the yellow dots WOULD be, continue to the edge of the grid.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...two red rectangle shapes on a black background, one on the left side and one on the right side. There is a number (one or many) light blue boxes located away from the top red rectangle.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...on the top shape, draw lines using light blue to connect the original light blue boxes to the red rectangle. Then, you will turn each original blue rectangle to yellow. On the bottom shape, you will mirror what you did on the top shape, except extend the lines all the way to the edge of the grid. You do not use any yellow on the bottom shape.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a 20x10 grid
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...remains the same
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...Fill in the light blue with yellow. Then connect the yellow to red, using the light blue color.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...two red base on each side with some light blue dots.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same as input grid.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to...copy the input grid and for the top red base, colored the blocks from red base to light blue block with light blue. Then change the top light blue block to yellow. For the bottom red side base, color the same color rows as the top with light blue to the full row

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...a black background with colored blocks.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...is the same.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to... add light blue blocks to the top red column to connect each light blue block to the red column forming its own row. Then add a single yellow block to the end of each light blue row. for the bottom red column make a light blue row going all the way across to the other side in the same position as the light blue rows you just made on the top red column.

descriptions.description_input: In the input, you should see...blue squares and red squares in a black background.
descriptions.description_output_grid_size: The output grid size...Remains the same.
descriptions.description_output: To make the output, you have to... replace blue squares with yellow squares and let the blue squares run from yellow squares to the red squares, while at the bottom use pattern from above to run from red squares through the width of the entire grid.

annotated_phrases.phrase: 2 red lines and 1 to 4 blue dots
change the dot color from blue to yellow, and connect them to the red line using blue dots.
Mirror the same design on the bottom but instead of stopping where the yellow dots WOULD be, continue to the edge of the grid.
